review_blob: Thank you Enzofan.   Mahogany pour with no head or carbonation.  Dark fruit and caramel/toffee on the nose.  Not much hop presence in aroma.  Smoke, alcohol, caramel, and oak dominate the flavor.  Reminds me of cognac.  Medium/full mouthfeel.  A bit of heat in the finish.  Very, very drinkable for 32% abv.  Enjoyable, and I would love to have another.
Thanks Enzofan, rated during blind tasting.  Dark brown/black pour with minimal head.  Caramel and bourbon on the nose.  Dark fruit, caramel, and oak in the flavors.  Medium mouth fell.
Rated during blind tasting.  Dark brown pour, minimal head.  Oak, brown sugar, and bourbon flavors.  Medium mouthfeel. Smooth finish with some heat.
beer_name: Shoreline Big Bourbon Series Lost Sailor Imperial Stout

review_blob: Thanks to Enzofan.  Rated during blind tasting.  Dark brown/black pour with thin tan head.  Vanilla, bourbon, caramel, and a whiff of pine on the the nose.  Toffee, vanilla, dark sugars, chocolate, and bourbon in the flavor.  medium mouthfeel.
beer_name: Jackie Os Bourbon Barrel Dark Apparition

review_blob: Thanks to Enzofan.  Rated in blind tasting.  Poured dark brown/black with lasting tan head.  Bourbon, vanilla, and roast on the nose.  Sweet malt, bourbon, chocolate, coffee flavors.  Medium mouthfeel.  Smooth finish.
beer_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Coffee

review_blob: Black pour with ruby edges.  Very thin dark brown head.  Unreal bittersweet chocolate aroma, vanilla and  black cherries also on the nose.  Big chocolate flavor with some vanilla in the background.  Full mouth-feel, almost syrupy.  Finish feels like a hunk of chocolate melting in your mouth.  Wow, if you like chocolate this is for you.  Abv very well hidden.  Not very complex, but enjoyable.

Bomber with the crappiest commercial label Ive ever seen.  Dark brown pour, color very thin at the edges, minimal white head.  Smells like butterscotch coffee.  More butterscotch and coffee in the flavor, tastes like it was diluted with water.  Thin palate.  Could not finish, drain pour.  This style can hide flaws due to the complexity of the flavors, but not this example.
Caramel color with thin white head.  Dark fruit and malt sweetness on the nose.  Flavors of toffee, dark fruit, sweet malt.  Medium mouth-feel.  Sweet malt.

Dark ruby pour with off white head.  Sweet malt, hops, and alcohol on the nose.  The beer tastes of dark fruit, sweet caramel, followed up with some hop bitterness.  Medium-full mouth-feel.  Nice balance.  Smooth finish.

12 oz. bottle 2010.  Golden/straw pour with foamy white head.  Nice lace.  Pine, citrus, grass, and alcohol on the nose.  Big pine resin bite on the initial taste, smooth alcohol burn, and then a bitter finish.  Some malt sweetness is showing up as well.  Medium/full mouth-feel, a little chewy.  Nice beer.  Very approachable and possibly dangerous due to the drinkability and the 9.1% abv.
beer_name: Great Lakes Lake Erie Monster Imperial IPA

review_blob: 12 oz. bottle.  Orange pour with white head with some sticky lace.  Orange, lemon, pine, and a whiff of grass on the nose.  Hop bite on the initial taste.  Pine resin, orange peel, lemon.....nice.  Not much balance, I think that was the point.  There is a hint of malt sweetness in the background to keep things interesting.  Medium mouthfeel.  A bit oily.  Dry long lasting bitter finish.  This may be my go to beer for the summer.  Great price at under $8/6pk.

Bottle.  Golden /orange pour with thick foamy white lasting head.   Mango and citrus notes in the nose.  Hop bitterness jumps out on initial taste.  More citrus, caramel,  and some pine resin in taste.  Very hoppy, but malt backbone holds up and beer is nicely balanced.  Finish starts smooth but develops into a slow alcohol burn with a pleasant bitterness.  Very good.

Very dark mahogany pour with some light at the edges.  Tan foamy head that quickly diminishes.  Well carbonated.  Smells of roasted coffee, dark malt, and a slight whiff of macadamia nuts.  Hops become more apparent, in flavor and aroma, as the beer warms.  More roasted coffee and dark malt in the flavor.  Also picking up some dark fruit and chocolate notes.  Nice creaminess to the mouthfeel.  Finish is slightly sweet, a bit chocolatey, with a hint of heat.
beer_name: Ken Schmidt / Maui / Stone Kona Coffee Macadamia Coconut Porter

review_blob: Growler.  Brilliant copper pour with lasting white foamy head.  Pine/citrus aromas with a touch of caramel.  Big hop bite on initial taste.  Hops are a little overpowering, NOT a bad thing.  The malt is a bit hard to pull out, but there seems to be a bit of balance.  A bit soapy.  Mouthfeel is medium/full.  Good carbonation, nice tingling sensation on the way down.  A bit of residual sweetness for the style, not as dry as I would expect but not objectionable.  Lingering bitterness in the finish.  Be warned, your palate will be shot for a bit after this one due to the hops.  Nice beer, and Cheers to the MadBrew Crew.

beer_brewer_name: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company
review_blob: Batch 75 bottle.  Dark brown/black pour with foamy, lasting two finger tan head.  Brown sugar and smoked malt on the nose.  Initial smokey flavor remains a constant thoughout.  Dark chocolate, dark fruit, and some malt sweetness come forward.  Full mouthfeel.  Dry smokey finish with a hint of heat.  Very good.

beer_brewer_name: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company
review_blob: Thank you Alan Henderson for the tip on where to aquire this tasty brew.  Batch 76 Bottle.  Pours golden/amber with a huge foamy white head.  Bottle is over carbonated and I had to let it rest for awhile.  Hard to get past the strong alcohol presence in the aroma.  Let the beer warm and the nice aromas show-up.  Toffee, pine, and dark fruits on the nose.  Very nicely balanced.  Pine resin, sweet caramel, honey, and orange peel come to mind in the flavor.  Complex but all the flavors work nicely together.  Full mouthfeel with a lingering sweet finish, slight alcohol burn as well.  Needs to age a bit, but very enjoyable as is.

Bottle.  Orange/copper pour with white foamy head.  Nice retention.  Orange peel, pine, sweet malt, and a hint of spice on the nose.  Very enjoyable aromas.  Flavors of oranges and pine resin.  A bit sweet, but still balanced.  Has a nice smooth bitterness that balances well with the malt.  Medium/full mouthfeel.  Smooth finish.  10% abv well hidden.  Very nice.

Can.  Dark amber pour with off-white head.  Very nice aroma.  Lots of sweet malt followed up with  pine aromas on the nose.    Well balanced, very sweet with a nice hop bit.  More pine and some orange peel in the flavor.   A bit thin on the mouthfeel.  More sweetness/bitterness in the finish, along with a hint of heat.

Bottle.  Copper/amber pour with white head.  Malty aroma with slight citrus and spice notes.  Not much jumps out with this beer.  Slightly heavy on the malt, not much hop presence.  Easy drinking sessionable beer with not much going on.

Bottle.  Dark orange/amber pour with foamy white head that diminishes into a slick of lace.  Aroma is awesome.  Mango, oranges, and pine.  Slight bitterness on the initial taste that gives way to some orange flavors, sweet malt, and pine resin.  Medium mouthfeel that is bit watery.  Slightly bitter finish with a touch of sweetness.  A bit tame for an IPA but smells great and it is very easy drinking.

Bottle.  Cloudy brown/amber pour with a foamy tan head.  Lots of carbonation.  Fruitiness and spice on the nose.  Very slight cocoa presence in the taste.  More fruity esters and some earthiness.  Medium mouthfeel.  Smooth finish.  Very nice.

Can.  Orange/amber pour with thin white head.  Nice lacing.  Aroma is dominated by pine resin and sweet malt.  Taste is bitter up front with more pine and some citrus flavors.  Nice maltiness as well, but the hops dominate.  Medium mouthfeel with bitter finish.  Very good beer.

Growler of 2009.  Amber/orange pour with a thin diminishing white head.  Orange/mango with a bit of pine resin on the nose.  Nice hop bitterness on the front that fades to some smooth hoppiness and malt flavors.  More orange and pine in the taste.  Slight sweetness.  More balanced than many IIPAs Ive had.  Very nice medium/full mouthfeel.  Light bitterness in the finish with some lingering sweetness.  A must have from Madbrew, nicely done Mr. Grantham!

Growler.  Dark brown pour with crimson edges.  Tan foamy head.  Dark roast and chocolate on the nose with some slight hop spice.  Smooth & creamy, medium mouthfeel.  Chocolate flavor is more mild than I was expecting, not much depth.  Decent beer worth checking out.

Bomber.  Orange/amber pour with soapy white head.  Great Lace.  Mango, orange and some pine on the nose.  Not as bitter as I was expecting, very well balanced.  Citrus on the front end in the flavor profile with the hops bringing up the rear.  Medium mouthfeel.  Mildly bitter and sweet finish.  Nice.

beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob: Bomber.  Orange/amber pour with thin quickly diminishing white head.  Pine, oranges, and sweet malt on the nose.  Orange/citrus and pine resin in the flavor.  A bit oily.  Medium/full mouthfeel.  Slightly bitter finish with some underlying sweetness.  Very well balanced beer with some complexity.  Very easy drinking and very nice.

Bottle.  Dark brown almost black pour with creamy lasting tan head.  Chocolate and sweet malt on the nose.  Coffee/chocolate bitterness on the front, as the tasty concoction slides to the back of the throat some sweetness becomes apparent.  Medium mouthfeel with a nice bit of carbonation to perk things up.  Smooth chocolate finish.

Bottle.  Black pour.  Thin off-white head quickly diminishes into a halo of lace.  Burnt roast, molasses,  and bitter coffee in the aroma.  Also a hint of green apple.  Enjoyed the beer until I actually tasted it.  Sourness with some butterscotch overtones.  Drain pour.

Draft at Trion - New Haven, IN.  Black pour with a thin tan head.  Looks like old motor oil.  Bourbon, toffee, burnt roast on the nose.  Bourbon and vanilla in the flavor.  Medium/full mouthfeel.  Smooth finish with a hint of heat.  Very, very nice.  Thanks Greg!!!

Bomber.  Golden pour with white head that quickly diminishes into a halo of lace.  Pine and grapefruit on the nose.  Flavor is initially sweet and then turns bitter.  Big hop presence, but the malt backbone stands up nicely.  More pine and citrus on the palate with hints of bitter orange peel.  A bit oily with a medium/full mouthfeel.  Sweet and bitter finish.  Very nice.

Bottle.  Orange/amber pour with thin white head diminishing into a slick of lace.  Mango and pine resin on the nose.  Big hop presence, mango/citrus/pine in taste.  A bit oily.  Malt is taking a back seat with this one.   Medium mouthfeel.  Bitter dry finish with a bit of heat.  Very nice.

2007 Bottle.  Oil black pour with no head to speak of.  Roast, molasses, hops, brown sugar, and pine resin on the nose.  The above in the flavor with hints of vanilla and soy sauce.  Full mouthfeel.  Bitter and sweet finish.    Very complex and enjoyable.
beer_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord Russian Imperial Stout

review_blob: Draft at MABC.  Pitch black pour with creamy tan head.  Roasted malt & whiff of hops on the nose.  Roasted malt and slight hop bitterness in the taste.  Nice balance but I would like it to be BIGGER.  A bit thin on the mouthfeel. Dry, bitter chocolate, roasted malt finish.  Nice drinking, but underwhelming.

Bottle.  Dark brown pour with foamy off-white head.  Nice lace.  Big caramel malt aromas, toffee, and spice.  Dark fruit, sweet malt, butterscotch, and a hint of chocolate in the flavor.  Alcohol is apparent but not overpowering.   Full bodied and chewy.  Finish is smooth and sweet with slight bitterness.  Very good!
beer_name: Dark Horse Scotty Karate Scotch Ale

review_blob: Bottle.  Amber/reddish pour with off-white foamy head.  Diminishes into a slick of lace.  Hops and spice on the nose.  Hops dominate upfront, all bitterness in the initial taste then gives way for maltiness.  Not balanced, but it does well not to be.  Medium mouthfeel.  Good beer, but not worth the $14.99 I paid for the six-pack.  Better beer around for less.

Bottle picked up at the Bells General Store.  Black pour with slight crimson edging.  Two finger tan head that quickly vanishes into a bubbling cascade of lace.  Appears to have lots of carbonation.  Cherries, dark fruit, vanilla, and some earthiness in the aroma.  Some oak pressence as well.  Wow, awesome flavor.  Bourbon shows up but does not overpower.  Cherry provides both sweet and sourness that nicely balances the beer.  Now that Im getting into it some chocolate is showing itself.  Medium/full mouthfeel, a treat for the palate.  Warming finish.  Great beer!
beer_name: Bells Cherry Stout - Bourbon Barrel Aged

review_blob: 2006 Bottle.  Dark brown pour.  Thin off-white head quickly diminishes into a halo of lace.  Oak, toffee, vanilla, and bourbon on the nose.  Very smooth on the palate.  Malt, vanilla, and bourbon flavors.  Nicely complex, very drinkable at 9.3%.  Medium-full mouthfeel.  Slightly astringent finish with some alcohol presence.  Ive often overlooked this beer in the past.  Try it, youll love it.
2007 Bottle.  Brown pour with thick and foamy brown head.  Great spice aromas.  Mint, coriander, and spruce are present in flavor.  Lots of spice.  Medium mouthfeel.  Very different.
beer_name: Anchor Our Special Ale (2005 and later)

beer_brewer_name: Magic Hat Brewing Company (North American Breweries)
review_blob: Dark amber pour with foamy off-white head.  Citrus, pine, grass, and a lot of hops on the nose.  Smells great.  Bitterness, piney resin on the front, and malt following in in the flavor.  Medium mouthfeel.  Bitter finish.  Very nice.

beer_brewer_name: Magic Hat Brewing Company (North American Breweries)
review_blob: Golden pour with white head.  Sticky lace.  Spice and lemon on the nose.  Bitter flavor, not much else to say.   Medium mouthfeel.  Bitter dull finish.

beer_brewer_name: Magic Hat Brewing Company (North American Breweries)
review_blob: Golden pour, cascade of bubbles, thin white head.  Aromas of malt, spice, grain, a bit musty.  Fruity taste, a bit acidic.  Medium mouthfeel.  Refreshing, maybe nice on a hot summer day.  Ill pass on another.

Bomber.  Copper/orange pour with foamy off-white head.  Spice, citrus, and malt on the nose.  Flavor is a bit different than what I may have expected.  Earthy, grass, malty, but well balanced with some bitterness.  Medium mouthfeel.  Sweet/bitter finish.  This tasted like a big British Pale, and a bit of a dissapointment.

Bomber.  Dark amber pour with lasting thick and foamy tan head.  Caramel and sweetness on the nose.  More caramel in the flavor, followed up with some dark fruit, chocolate,  and hop bitterness.  Medium/full mouthfeel, a little chewy.  Chocolatey/bitter finish that makes me want another pour.  Great beer for a $3.99/bomber.
beer_name: Barrel House Boss Cox Double Dark IPA

review_blob: 12 oz. bottle.  Deep ruby/amber pour.  Thin off-white head that quickly turns into a halo of lace.  Malt, dark fruit, and a whiff of alcohol in the aroma.   Huge malt backbone balanced with a piney resinous hop presence.  Full mouthfeel, a bit sticky,....very delicious.  Bitter lasting finish.  This beer ROCKS, and very drinkable.

Golden pour with thick foamy lasting head.  Nice cascade of rising bubbles.  Piney resinous aroma, slight citrus presence.  Hop bomb, very bitter.  Malt shows up, but it plays second fiddle to the crescendo of hops.  Medium/full mouthfeel, syrupy.  More balanced when warms up a bit.  Very Good!

2008 Bottle. Courtesy of Enzofan.  Ink black pour with thick foamy tan head.  Great lace.  Chocolate, roast, slight green apple aroma.  Chocolate flavors and roast dominate.  Slight smokiness in there as well.  Full velvety mouthfeel.  Smooth, warming finish.  Very good, but a bit over-hyped.

Bomber shared with Enzofan.  Cloudy golden/orange pour with diminishing off-white head.  Big malt aroma, no hop presence.  No suprise due to age of beer.  Sweet malt flavors.  Medium syrupy mouthfeel.  This was a good beer, but Im sure it was fantastic fresh in its day.  Enjoyable none the less.

Golden pour, thick white head that quickly  diminishes.  Big Earthy aroma, sweet malt, hay, a bit of a different aroma for this style.  Balanced flavor, big malt presence.  Medium/Full mouthfeel, a bit syrupy and sweet.  Warming finish.  Good beer.

Bottle.  Ruby/amber pour with off-white diminishing head.  Continuous cascade of tiny bubbles rise from the depths to form a slick of lace.  Aromas of sweet malt, caramel, and a wiff of alcohol.  Bitter on the initial taste, but not overpowering.  More sweet caramel follows.  Great balance.  Medium/full mouthfeel, a bit chewy.  Bitter, warming finish.  Not as complex as some, but very good.
Orange/amber pour, thin diminishing white head.  Mango and citrus on the nose.  Citrus flavors with bitterness throughout.  A bit thin on the palate.  Decent balance, clean uneventful finish.
